DataElement.preferredName: Hearing Ear Infection Assessment Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The auditory faculty, the perception of sound by the ear._Inflammation of the ear, which may be marked by pain, fever, abnormalities of hearing, hearing loss, tinnitus, and vertigo. Inflammation of the external ear is OTITIS EXTERNA; of the middle ear, OTITIS MEDIA; of the inner ear, LABYRINTHITIS. (From Dorland, 27th ed)_The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._The words of something written.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The auditory faculty, the perception of sound by the ear.

Concepts.definition: The auditory faculty, the perception of sound by the ear.

Property.preferredDefinition: Inflammation of the ear, which may be marked by pain, fever, abnormalities of hearing, hearing loss, tinnitus, and vertigo. Inflammation of the external ear is OTITIS EXTERNA; of the middle ear, OTITIS MEDIA; of the inner ear, LABYRINTHITIS. (From Dorland, 27th ed)

Concepts.definition: A viral or bacterial infection that affects the external, middle, or inner ear.  It may follow an upper respiratory infection.  Signs and symptoms include pain, ear discharge, ear fullness, hearing loss, vertigo, nausea, and vomiting.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
